articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt, Idrees Ali, Sabine Siebold
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden and leaders of other NATO member states are poised to unveil new aid and reiterate a membership pledge for Ukraine at a summit in Washington after the U.S. leader vowed to defend Kyiv against Russia's invasion.
articles.title: Biden, NATO poised to unveil Ukraine aid, reiterate membership pledge at summit

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces pressed their offensive in north and central Gaza on Wednesday, hours after an airstrike on a tent encampment that Palestinian officials said killed more than two dozen people and as negotiations to end the fighting were set to resume.
articles.title: Israel presses Gaza offensive hours after deadly airstrike on tent camp

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: NATO allies will pledge to support Ukraine on an "irreversible path" to integration and call on China to cease all support for Russia's war effort against Kyiv, according to a draft joint communique seen by Reuters on Wednesday.
articles.title: NATO slams China over Russia support, backs full integration of Ukraine, draft communique says

articles.author: Benoit Van Overstraeten, Zhifan Liu
articles.description: Leaders from the left-wing bloc that topped France's legislative election on Sunday and the runner-up centrists continued on Wednesday a frenzied race to try to put together rival bids to form a viable government.
articles.title: French left and centrists tussle to form government

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United States will start deploying long-range fire capabilities in Germany in 2026 in an effort to demonstrate its commitment to NATO and European defense, the United States and Germany said in a joint statement on Wednesday.
articles.title: US to start deploying long-range weapons in Germany in 2026

articles.author: Thomas Escritt
articles.description: The Alternative for Germany (AFD) joined forces with other far-right parties to form a third far-right party alliance in the European Parliament on Wednesday, a group member said.
articles.title: Germany's spurned AfD creates third far-right EU parliament group

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: India has no right to carry out development in the area China calls South Tibet, China's Foreign Ministry said on Wednesday in response to a Reuters report on New Delhi's plans to speed up hydropower projects in the border state.
articles.title: China says India has no right to develop contested border region

articles.author: Lizbeth Diaz
articles.description: Mexican navy officials running the country's biggest port are increasingly concerned about the rising flows of unregulated "dual use" chemicals used to produce synthetic drugs such as methamphetamine and fentanyl, four Navy officials told Reuters.
articles.title: Mexico's navy warns dual use chemicals are boosting meth production

articles.author: Laila Bassam, Timour Azhari
articles.description: Hezbollah chief Sayyed Hassan Nasrallah said Hamas was conducting Gaza ceasefire talks with Israel on behalf of the entire "Axis of Resistance" and, if a deal was reached, Hezbollah would stop its operations with no need for separate talks.
articles.title: Lebanon's Hezbollah chief: Hamas negotiates on behalf of the entire Axis of Resistance

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine's top prosecutor accused Russian forces on Wednesday of killing two Ukrainian servicemen who were captured in June in the partially-occupied southeastern Zaporizhzhia region.
articles.title: Ukraine accuses Russia of killing two prisoners of war
